title: Custom root type iteration and subsciption
body:
# Feature Request

Output of `python -c "import pydantic.utils; print(pydantic.utils.version_info())"`:
```
             pydantic version: 1.5a1
            pydantic compiled: False
                 install path: /home/kuhnm/projects/pydantic/pydantic
               python version: 3.8.2 (default, Feb 26 2020, 22:21:03)  [GCC 9.2.1 20200130]
                     platform: Linux-5.4.28-1-MANJARO-x86_64-with-glibc2.2.5
     optional deps. installed: ['devtools']
```
<!-- or if you're using pydantic prior to v1.3, manually include: OS, python version and pydantic version -->

<!-- Please read the [docs](https://pydantic-docs.helpmanual.io/) and search through issues to
confirm your feature hasn't been asked for before, or already implemented. -->

<!-- Where possible please include a self-contained code snippet describing your feature request: -->


Hi! I wanted to ask if it's feasible to have `__iter__` and `__getitem__` automatically implemented when using custom root types. At the moment this has to be done manually, as shown in the following example. If not, would it be possible to add this example to the docs?

```py
from typing import List, Dict
from pydantic import BaseModel, ValidationError

class Pets(BaseModel):
    __root__: List[str]

    def __iter__(self):
        return iter(self.__root__)

    def __getitem__(self, item):
        return self.__root__[item]


pets = Pets.parse_obj(['dog', 'cat'])
print(pets[0])
#> dog
print([pet for pet in pets])
#> ['dog', 'cat']
```
